ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Good introduction to game theory. Essential for any quantitative social scientist (not just economics).

Rigorous, fast-paced, game theory class. Very good instructors. Important for students that need advanced foundation in microeconomics. Strongly recommend having solid math background in calculus and have taken at least an intermediate level game theory course before.
I'd recommend it but that's because I like the material.
I would strongly recommend the course since is a great summary of game theory, from the basic concepts to the more advance topics.
I would recommend it if that fellow student would like to get a good foundation in game theory.
Anyone interested in a basic understanding of advance topics of game theory, this course is very useful.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Crucial for my fields (political economy and applied micro).
Very helpful to understand treatment of uncertainty in microeconomics as well as some very important models such as adverse selection.
I am really interested in game theory now. I didn't really know what it was beforehand.
I will find out next year.
This course helps me in looking to what I knew in a different perspective and to learn a lot of thing that will be essential in my future research.
I think having a good idea of the foundations of game theory is essential to be an economist no matter what your area is. This course helped me a lot in that sense.
I am not a theorist, but game theory is a fundamental tool for models, so I think it will be very useful in my future research
